intro: Valerianella auricula var. dasycarpa, commonly known as the woolly sorrel, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a unique and easily identifiable species within its ecological niche.
